result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell J Wilson

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 10-04-2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH E.M. dob 7-10-1994. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. *

Defendant Russell J Wilson in court, in custody.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Russell J Wilson.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to amend bond by Attorney Ryan. Victim present, makes statement. Bond amended. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Victim's Request to Lift the No Contact
Signed bond filed with the court.
*AMENDED 9/9/2022: CONTACT WITH VICTIM ALLOWED DURING TREATMENT SESSIONS ONLY.

Defendant Russell J Wilson in court, in custody.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Russell J Wilson.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Josh Ryan. State objects to bond motion. Bond amended to allow contact during treatment sessions only. Victim present. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Russell J Wilson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Josh Ryan appeared. Victim is present. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Ryan. Argument, denied at this time. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Complaint read by court. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Motion hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Victim's Request to Lift No Contact
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 10-04-2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH E.M. dob 7-10-1994. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.*
*AMENDED 9/9/2022: CONTACT WITH VICTIM ALLOWED DURING TREATMENT SESSIONS ONLY.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH E.M. dob 7-10-1994. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Russell J Wilson in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
